result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

amended to signature

10:37 am  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JAMES W. LYONS JR. appeared by video from jail.  Defendant does qualify for PD services but doesn't have an attorney.  Wants to waive his right to an attorney and proceed with the case.  Judge goes through waiver thoroughly and questions the defendant about waiving.  Thoroughly warns the defendant.  
Defendant has reached out to the DA office but hasn't heard anything back.  
ADA Kaupie comes into courtroom.  Takes over.  Go off record for attorney to talk to defendant.  
10:45 back on record.  ADA Kaupie has received correspondence but hasn't had time to respond.  
ADA Kaupie motions the court to amend the cash bond to a signature bond with same conditions.  In exchange for signature bond.  Defendant will withdraw his speedy trial demand.  Will keep checking in with the PD office to see if they find him an attorney.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Eligible for SPD services
